Part 1¶

This is part one of Assignment 1

Car module¶

Action Enum¶

class Part1.Car.Action[source]¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

An enum class used to represent actions for cars.

DRIVE = 1¶

Drive action variable (is 1).

Type:DRIVE (int)
WAIT = 0¶

Wait action variable (is 0).

Type:WAIT (int)

Car Class¶

class Part1.Car.Car(score: int = 0)[source]¶

Bases: object

A super class for representing a car in simulation.

action = 0¶

Action currently chosen by car (default is WAIT).

Type:action (Action, optional)
drove_over = False¶

Whether car has driven over bridge (default is False).

Type:drove_over (bool, optional)
print_data() → None[source]¶

Prints out action and score for car to console.

Rewards action taken by car, NOT IMPLEMENTED.

Parameters:reward (int) – Reward value, can be negative.
score = 0¶

Score earned by car in simulation.

Type:score (int, optional)

Takes action for car, NOT IMPLEMENTED.

Random Car Class¶

class Part1.Car.RandomCar(score: int = 0)[source]¶

Bases: Part1.Car.Car

Zero intelligence car, takes random actions and learns nothing.

reward_action(reward: int) → None[source]¶

Rewards action taken by car, simply updates score.

Parameters:reward (int) – Reward value, can be negative.
take_action() → None[source]¶

Takes random action for car.

Learning Car Class¶

class Part1.Car.LearningCar(score: int = 0, learn_factor: float = 0.9, decay_factor: float = 0.5)[source]¶

Bases: Part1.Car.Car

Learning car, takes actions based on Q-Learning algorithm.

decay_factor = 0.5¶

Decay factor for car (default is 0.5).

Type:decay_factor (float, optional)
learn_factor = 0.9¶

Learning factor for car (default is 0.9).

Type:learn_factor (float, optional)
print_data() → None[source]¶

Prints out score, state, action and Q-matrix for car to console.

q_matrix = None¶

Q matrix for car (default is 2x2 zero matrix).

Type:q_matrix (array, optional)
reward_action(reward: int) → None[source]¶

Rewards action taken by car using Q-Learning algorithm.

Using reward argument and Q-Learning algorithm updates learns the car to take actions. Updates score and state for car.

Parameters:reward (int) – Reward value, can be negative.
state = None¶

Current state for car (default is either WAIT or DRIVE).

Type:state (Action, optional)
take_action() → None[source]¶

Takes action for car based on its current state and Q matrix.

If all actions have equal Q value, take random action. Take action with biggest Q value otherwise.

Simulation module¶

State Enum¶

class Part1.Simulation.State[source]¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

An enum class used to represent states in simulation.

BOTH_WAIT = 1¶

Both cars wait state variable (is 1).

Type:BOTH_WAIT (int)
CAR_1_DROVE = 2¶

Car 1 drove while 2 waited state variable (is 2).

Type:CAR_1_DROVE (int)
CAR_2_DROVE = 3¶

Car 2 drove while 1 waited state variable (is 3).

Type:CAR_2_DROVE (int)
CRASH = 0¶

Crash state variable (is 0).

Type:CRASH (int)

Simulation Class¶

class Part1.Simulation.Simulation(car1: Car.Car, car2: Car.Car, state: Part1.Simulation.State = <State.BOTH_WAIT: 1>, debug: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class for simulating one lane bridge crossing problem.

It takes in two cars and uses them to simulate games finally showing a graph with scores for each cars gained through simulation. Simulates games where each car tries to cross a one lane bridge. Each game lasts until both cars have safely crossed the bridge or crashed.

car1 = None¶

First car used in simulation.

Type:car1 (Car)
car1_scores = None¶

List of scores for car 1 after each game (default is an empty list).

Type:car1_scores (List[int], optional)
car2 = None¶

Second car used in simulation.

Type:car2 (Car)
car2_scores = None¶

List of scores for car 2 after each game (default is an empty list).

Type:car2_scores (List[int], optional)
check_state() → None[source]¶

Checks game state after each car took action.

cleanup_game() → None[source]¶

Adds scores for cars to list, resets state and drove_over for cars.

debug = False¶

Whether to print status messages to (default is False).

Type:debug (bool, optional)
give_rewards() → None[source]¶

Gives rewards to each car based on current turn state.

First it finds reward value based on turn state, then calls reward_action in each car as long as it hasn’t driven over the bridge.

show_graph() → None[source]¶

Shows graph with scores for each car after simulation.

simulate_games(no_games: int) → None[source]¶

Simulates a given amount of games for the cars.

This method runs the whole simulation calling methods in class to play out games and turns in the game. For each game it lets cars take action, checks turn state, and gives rewards. After each game it cleans up and runs again until it has ran the required amount of games. In the end it shows plot of car scores.

Parameters:no_games (int) – Number of games to simulate.
state = 1¶

State for current turn in game (default is BOTH_WAIT).

Type:state (State, optional)
take_actions() → None[source]¶

Lets each car that hasn’t crossed bridge take an action.
